quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 11 Quiz 7
quiz.subtitle: 11.7: Applications of Vectors
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Resultant forces, work, and velocity vectors

questions.question: A plane is flying at 500 mph North, but a wind is blowing 50 mph East. What is the plane's actual groundspeed?
questions.explanation: The velocity is a right triangle with legs 500 and 50. Use the Pythagorean theorem: √(500² + 50²) = √(250,000 + 2,500).

questions.question: If a force $\mathbf{F} = \langle 10, 20 \rangle$ moves an object along displacement $\mathbf{d} = \langle 5, 2 \rangle$, how much work is done?
Two forces of 10 N and 15 N act on an object at an angle of 0° (same direction). What is the magnitude of the resultant force?
questions.explanation: When vectors point in the exact same direction, their magnitudes simply add together.

questions.question: In the work formula $W = \|\mathbf{F}\| \|\mathbf{d}\| \cos \theta$, what happens if the force is applied perpendicular to the direction of motion?
questions.explanation: If the angle is 90°, cos(90°) = 0, meaning no work is done (e.g., carrying a heavy box horizontally—the upward force doesn't contribute to the horizontal displacement).

questions.question: A boat's motor pushes it at 20 knots at a bearing of 90° (East). A current pushes it at 5 knots at 270° (West). What is the resultant velocity?
questions.explanation: The vectors are in opposite directions. 20 - 5 = 15 knots in the original direction (East).

questions.question: True or False: The 'Resultant Vector' is simply the sum of all individual vector components acting on an object.
questions.explanation: True. To find the net effect, you add all the x-components and all the y-components.

questions.question: If an object is in 'equilibrium', what is the sum of all force vectors acting upon it?
questions.explanation: Equilibrium means all forces cancel each other out, resulting in a net force of zero.

questions.question: Find the magnitude of the resultant force if $\mathbf{F_1} = 3\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j}$ and $\mathbf{F_2} = 5\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{j}$.
A person pulls a wagon with a force of 50 lbs at an angle of 30° to the ground. What is the horizontal component of this force?
questions.explanation: The horizontal component is the magnitude times the cosine of the angle: 50 * (√3/2) ≈ 43.3 lbs.

questions.question: What is the unit for Work in the metric system if force is in Newtons and displacement is in meters?
questions.explanation: One Joule is defined as the work done by a force of one Newton moving an object one meter.

scoreMessages.90: Physics Pro! You've mastered the application of vectors.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember that groundspeed is the magnitude of the resultant vector.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing the dot product for work calculations.
scoreMessages.0: Review how to add vectors component-wise and use the Pythagorean theorem for magnitude.
